targets.expr:
"\tvm_slow_query_stats" | extract 'vm_slow_query_stats <vm_slow_query_stats>' | unpack_logfmt from vm_slow_query_stats 
| tenant:in($tenant)
| query_hash:in($query_hash)
| type:="instant"
| count()

"\tvm_slow_query_stats" | extract 'vm_slow_query_stats <vm_slow_query_stats>' | unpack_logfmt from vm_slow_query_stats 
| tenant:in($tenant)
| query_hash:in($query_hash) 
| type:="range"
| count()

"\tvm_slow_query_stats" | extract 'vm_slow_query_stats <vm_slow_query_stats>' | unpack_logfmt from vm_slow_query_stats 
| tenant:in($tenant)
| query_hash:in($query_hash) 
| series_fetched:=0
| count()

panels.description:
Finds the min `start_ms` field over the selected time interval.
See https://docs.victoriametrics.com/victoriametrics/query-stats/#log-fields

targets.expr:
"\tvm_slow_query_stats" | extract 'vm_slow_query_stats <vm_slow_query_stats>' | unpack_logfmt from vm_slow_query_stats 
| tenant:in($tenant)
| query_hash:in($query_hash) 
| stats min(start_ms)

panels.title: The oldest queried timestamp

options.content: To filter by specific query copy its hash from the table and put it into `query_hash` filter on the top. To disable filtering enter `*`.

targets.expr:
"\tvm_slow_query_stats" | extract 'vm_slow_query_stats <vm_slow_query_stats>' | unpack_logfmt from vm_slow_query_stats 
| tenant:in($tenant)
| query_hash:in($query_hash)
| stats by(tenant,query,query_hash) max(execution_duration_ms) duration_max 
| sort by(duration_max) desc | limit $top

"\tvm_slow_query_stats" | extract 'vm_slow_query_stats <vm_slow_query_stats>' | unpack_logfmt from vm_slow_query_stats 
| tenant:in($tenant)
| query_hash:in($query_hash)
| stats max(execution_duration_ms) execution_duration_max

"\tvm_slow_query_stats" | extract 'vm_slow_query_stats <vm_slow_query_stats>' | unpack_logfmt from vm_slow_query_stats 
| tenant:in($tenant)
| query_hash:in($query_hash)
| stats by(tenant,query,query_hash) max(series_fetched) series_fetched_max
| sort by(series_fetched_max) desc | limit $top

panels.title: Top $top queries by max series fetched

list.description: Query hash filters queries by the hash of their expression. The hash is displayed in tables and in raw logs.
